answers.author: Chase Carlile
answers.text:
Susan,
Salt Lake City, Utah has restrictions that limit the density of bars in different area's of the city.  Here is a link to  subsection 6.08.120 of the Salt Lake City Code which stipulates how many bars can go in a particular area.  
http://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=672
For more information you can call the Salt Lake City Business License Division at 801.535.6644 or the Salt Lake City's Planning and Zoning Buzz Center at 801.535.7700

author: Susan Griffin
text:
The Peninsula Strategic Issues Team made up of City of Charleston, SC personnel and chaired by the Police Chief is seeking information on whether your city or town has a set of standards, zoning requirements, or policy practices that regulate the density of bar placements.
Please reply to griffins@charleston-sc.gov
Thank you very much.
title: Density of bar placements
